intro: Decaschistia intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate decaschistia, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Decaschistia intermedia is often found in areas with high humidity and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
